content: Guys, the spanish community needs some forum space and wiki space to start contributing support and documentation. Would you support us or should we build and host our own website?
@develCuy - So, will there be a Backdrop User Group in Spanish?

Do we need an area in the forum for people to post questions in Spanish?
My concern about this would be to make sure that we have people willing to answer in Spanish before we set this up.
Since we are a community, we have both new and experienced users, we only need a place to record evidence that will serve as reference for future issues and for improving the documentation itself
Has there been any talk of making b.org multilingual? That could end up being quite a few languages. Or let other groups set up similar sites in own language?

@Herb - Great question. I was disappointed that we didn't have a discussion on multilingual at Backdrop LIVE, because I'm completely unfamiliar with what we have for multilingual in Backdrop and hence have no idea how difficult it would be to make Backdropcms.org into a multilingual site.

The German speaking community does parts of this on a custom website: https://backdrop-cms.de/blog We have no forum yet, but post regularly. So maybe a custom website could be a quicker solution for the Spanish community, too?
